etymology.description: semantic: 广(广) (guǎng, 'wide') + phonetic: 尙(尚) (shàng, 'still') = a place that is wide or grand -> refers historically to the Tang dynasty
etymology.interpretation: The character 唐(táng) combines 广(广) (guǎng, 'wide') suggesting an expanse or grandeur with the phonetic 尙(尚) (shàng, 'still'), hinting at something esteemed or significant, fitting for the influential Tang dynasty.

examples.chinese: 唐朝是中国历史上繁荣的朝代(唐朝是中國歷史上繁榮的朝代)。
examples.pinyin: Táng cháo shì Zhōngguó lìshǐ shàng fánróng de cháodài.
examples.english: The Tang dynasty was a prosperous era in Chinese history.

examples.chinese: 唐代诗人创作了许多脍炙人口的诗篇(唐代詩人創作了許多脍炙人口的詩篇)。
examples.pinyin: Táng dài shīrén chuàngzuò le xǔduō kuàizhì rénkǒu de shīpiān.
examples.english: Poets of the Tang dynasty composed many poems that remain popular.

examples.chinese: 唐朝开放交流(唐朝開放交流)，使中外文化交融(使中外文化交融)。
examples.pinyin: Táng cháo kāifàng jiāoliú, shǐ zhōngwài wénhuà jiāoróng.
examples.english: The Tang dynasty promoted open exchanges, which led to the blending of Chinese and foreign cultures.
